page.title: 03MADELEY STAFFS : FARMING
page.content: Farming is the main industry in the area.The soil ranges from light sandy to loamy clay.There is a small area of spoil tip reclaimed for agriculture.The farms are mainly small,family-run dairy units from 40-250 acres.Increased grass production and efficiency are essential now,because Government has forced on dairy farmers production limits.Since quotas came in,in 1983 many farmers find it necessary to change from large specialised units to a mixed system. Some grow barley for animal feed.Others have found rearing sheep improves grass production.Sheep trim grass closely which helps growth.Pasture & managed grassland provide the main land cover with occasional areas to conserve wild life.Many footpaths though not visible are marked by stiles & are widely used by walkers.
